page.title: 19BIOGRAPHIES
page.content:
SIR MICHAEL TIPPET Tippet's early education was undertaken by his mother, at thirteen he gained a Scholarship to Fetters College in Edinburgh, bu he disliked it and transferred in 1920 to Stamford Grammar School. He trained as a professional pianist, and was taught by Francis Tinkler. He then studied at the Royal College of music 1923-8. Since he was forty he has come to be regarded as one of the most original figures in 20th century music.
M.J.K.SMITH Michael John Knight Smith attended Stamford School from 1943 to 1951 He captained Leicester for many years and received an O.B.E. in 1976. He has played both rugby and cricket for Engl and. He has scored over 2000 runs for his county in two separate seasons.
